stories.text:
Today, I was driving to work, and as I often do, I slowed down, to let a car from a side-street onto the main road, he saw it, waved to thank me, and proceeded to drive out in front of a cyclist who braked, fell and hurt her hand.

My wife said I didn't cause this, but I most certainly did, if I hadn't slowed down, he'd not driven in front of her, and she had not fallen.

I wited to see that she was alright, but couldn't block traffic for long, I saw that he went out to see to her, and we continued.

I'm left with a feeling of guilt, my action directly lead to a fellow human getting hurt.. I don't have any way to get into contact with those involved in this accident, and I'd like some advice on how to cope with this.
stories.title: Ask HN: I feel I caused a traffic accident, what to do?
